title: Stage 1 going for hours
body:
I saw in several places that stage 1 (header download) would take around 18 min on mainnet.

Mine has been going for several hours now. Machine has 32GB of RAM (15 GB free), CPU load average is around 3 (4 core intel CPU) and I see little network being used and even less I/O used.

What is the likely bottleneck? What could be the explanation for this? Ultra crap quality peers?

I start Erigon as:
```
./bin/erigon  \
  --datadir=/home/data/ethereum/mainnet/execution/erigon  \
  --syncmode=full \
  --prune.r.before=11184524 \
  --prune=htc \
  --private.api.addr=127.0.0.1:8181 \
  --port=31303 \
```

Some logs:
```
May 27 10:12:12 endor erigon[1539183]: [INFO] [05-27|10:12:12.164] Disk storage enabled for ethash DAGs     dir=/home/data/ethereum/mainnet/execution/erigon/ethash-dags count=2

May 27 14:32:53 endor erigon[1580681]: [INFO] [05-27|14:32:53.453] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=31
```

Running commit ```13a1b3c19f8bf2e4d9a8ba668218928228467e05```  from Fri May 27

```zsh
git fetch --tags
git reset v2022.05.08 --hard
make erigon
```
Two hours ago I did just that and been running ```2022.05.8-alpha-1d2551e0```, it is still in Stage 1, as slow as before

I am entering the 10th hour of ```[1/16 Headers] Inserting headers``` now
If this is the stage that should take 18min, it will take 5 months to sync ðŸ˜‚

more logs:
```

You can see it went from block ```12189546``` to block ```12288568``` in more than 5 minutes, absolute disastrous speed to simply download and save headers. Where should I look for bottlenecks? All machine resources are mostly idle

I wiped the data and started syncing again, and it took 5 minutes to sync 100k headers...
```

Plenty of CPU available, SSD NVMe capable of 3 GB/s with not even 10% of usage

You just have too few peers it seems like
```
INFO[05-27|21:49:49.946] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=4
```

This stage is networking-bound and dependent on the amount and quality of the peers. Try opening p2p ports so other nodes can discover yours.
will close it for now, please reopen if you have issues even when you have > 20 peers
